title: How a player SHOULD be ranked
body:
I know Riot probably wont see this, and if they do, probably not do anything about it. But i'll put it out there anyway.
I think the rank system needs to be switched up. It is making bad players climb and good players drop.
I think the rank system should be based on a players individual performance per game, which determines what rank/division they are and how much LP they get. A win or a loss should not even be taken into consideration.

Sure its a team game, but you never usually have the same team all the time. Why rank an individual up or down based on the teams performance, when each individual has their own rank anyway regardless of what team they are in.

Even if you had a world class top 3 player, queuing with say 4 of me. And played us against Golds or even Silvers. That player would still struggle to carry the team, and inevitably continuous loses would rank them far lower than what they really are.

Will ranks ever be a TRUE reflection of an individuals skill level at League? Because I feel the current system is a false reflection to some.

Ok so what we are basically surmising here, is that individual ranking is not determined by individual performance, rather individual ranking is determined by your impact on team performance?

Your right, the current rank system has its flaws and isn't perfect. But the system your trying to suggest would simply make the matter worse.

To be perfectly honest here, and i mean this with all respect, but you don't know enough about this game to understand why this is a bad idea, i looked you up and you're bronze 3 and do not even play ranked. This is not how league of legends works, it's all about teamwork, and how you move around the map to pressure other lanes. This system would not work for the game that league of legends is, this is not street fighter, it's not a 1v1 game. How well you do in lane is meaningless if you don't affect other lanes, You could go 10/0 in lane and have perfect cs, but if you don't bring that lead to other lanes, you'll end up throwing the game. The current rank system, while frustrating, is perfectly fine for  league of legends, just because we have Bronze to Challenger, does not mean the rank system has changed from back when we had mmr rating, it's the same system just hidden behind Bronze-Challenger

This is correct, i am still learning this game. And the fact that i am bronze 3 proves my point. I was carried there, i am not actually a bronze 3 skilled player.
Played 8 ranked in a row (thanks to the system, solo queuing put me with golds and some silvers, so i lost all 8 surprise surprise). So i was actually unranked still after 8 losses in a row. I then decided to queue with 2 other friends, who are half decent. Won the next 2 ranked games in a row, and somehow went from unranked level 30 to bronze 3.

Credit where its due, i did ok those 2 games, but i was carried there. I dont deserve the rank i have, and thats what is wrong with this ranking system imo

Let's be realistic, Riot has seen hundreds of posts suggesting individual performance systems, at least one of which I'm sure they pondered for a moment, and they've rejected them all. Heck, most players responding to those posts are convinced it's flawed too. It always boils down to League not being the kind of game where an individual score is able to explain the context of that score, how good the player is to have got that score or how it even impact the outcome. For example, you can't say that

>A win or a loss should not even be taken into consideration.

without considering the aim of the game. _Destroy the enemy nexus_. To change the aim to "obtain the best score" would shift the dynamic towards more selfish playstyles where kda is king. In Call of Duty's team deathmatch mode where there are 0 objectives beyond killing the enemy there is a clear reason to employ this kind of playstyle and room for such a performance rating system to exist. League on the other hand is the convergence of more nuanced tactics and ideas that do not revolve around the kda but directly lead to destroying the nexus (like zoning, vision control and stopping recalls amongst many others). I just don't think there's a system that could fairly and consistently evaluate the performance of a player in League, better than win/loss, and I doubt there ever will.

>Even if you had a world class top 3 player... that player would still struggle to carry the team

Finally, it's difficult to remove oneself from their own subjective Ranked experience, especially in regards to frustration and futility, but world class players generally have no problem carrying games far beneath them. In general, their superior mechanics and game knowledge allow them (and those dirty elo-boosters) to rank up multiple accounts quickly and effortlessly to diamond. I wasn't convinced of this until I realised how generously I was double promoted twice in a row from G5 > G3 > G1 and passed promos into P5 on the first go on another account. Now, I know I'm not the best player but if I was able to do this as a __support__ main I'm sure the Doublelift's and Bjergsen's of the world would have 0 problem doing it no matter what rating they were placed in simply by playing the game the way it was designed to be played - to destroy the enemy nexus.

The ranked system isn't flawed at all in my opinion. Yeah, you might get a bad team every now and then, but overall you will climb depending on what rank you deserve.

Remember, the enemy team is just as likely to get an AFK, feeder, troll or toxic player as you are.

Plus, having your rank based on your personal score is just plain stupid, sorry. This game would lose everything good and fun about it and just turn into a farming minions simulator to get a better rank.

> Plus, having your rank based on your personal score is just plain stupid, sorry. This game would lose everything good and fun about it and just turn into a farming minions simulator to get a better rank.

This.

Even though I hate trying to rank up with teams that are so bad, I'd prefer to challenge that so I can overcome them in the future.

You could always discount the farm in the scoring system. At the end of the day, being fed means squat if you're able to get a great kda anyway?
If you end up with say 15/3/8 with 105CS and your laning opponent ends up with 3/10/5 and 380CS, what does farm really matter in the end?

I guess my question is, does being a great individual talent with the ability to outplay and get kills make you a great player, or does being a participative team player with ability to complete objectives make you a great player?

Perhaps I'm looking at this completely wrong, but I feel this system is less rewarding for those that carry a game and lose anyway. (definitely not me, ftr. I've carried a game once in 500 games lol)

also with 380cs, that lane opponent will probably have just as much if not more gold than you; or at least you're both full build at this point meaning neither farm nor kills matter and objectives will be the deciding factor. Also if that was a 380 farm nasus or veigar you've just lost your team the game. On another note; how come denying last hits and zoning doesn't contribute to game score. If I manage to make my enemy nasus have 20cs at 20min and I have 140cs that's an achievement and I should get some bonus for this. Like for every 50cs the lane opponent is below average, your cs value used in the calculation is increased by 20.

I have a question for you then? A shaco that goes 0-1-11 in a game where his team has 14 kills total and is pressuring all lanes is carrying through getting his laners ahead and is doing his job beautifully; but a shaco that goes 11-1-0 could only be farming the enemy jungler and ksing and isn't really helping his lanes, especially as a champ that falls off and can't hard carry teamfights. The former shaco is playing much much better but the latter shaco will have a better score and more jungle cs. Does the latter shaco deserve a higher rank than the former shaco? No, no he does not cause he is not playing better, he's just playing more selfishly. How good your score is is redundant. It's about game impact and kills don't equal wins. Not to mention I feel the current rating system doesn't weigh towers, dragons, barons, kill participation or total damage done as much as it should.
The current system is infuriating but I feel at least over a large enough number of games, your total game impact and how much you contribute to a win is evaluated

An individual scoring system that gives a bonus or a reduction on how well you play would be way better. Base it on how well you do in a game in all aspects so if you do alot you can get slightly increased lp gain or slighty reduced lp loss if you do very little and troll or int feed you get nothing ie it the standard lp gain/loss (you lose!good day sir!)

So say if someone sits back and afk farms because they feel they are going to lose they wont get a good rank and wont get decreased lp. But if someones like we may lose but im gonna play my ass off because we could comeback and play well but still lose they would get reduced lp loss.

This would sort out the low elos pretty well imho and it might encourage more players to not give up so easily and try a bit harder to comeback.

While I agree that teamwork wins games, not trying to be a hero, it is impossible for an automated system to judge how well you 'teamplayed'.

I only play ARAM these days (approaching 2.5k wins), as I despise the 'farmcentric' (yes, I think I just coined that word), aspect of summoners rift play. If I want to farm, I'll go play Path of Exile.

In ARAM, I am very much a team player. Even if that means I have to initiate every fight, die first and get a low kill score so that the team can win the fight overall, sacrifice myself to buy time so that the rest of the team can retreat in a fight that has gone poorly, etc.
ARAM seems to have it's own MMR, and I usually find myself on a team like a diamond, 2 plats and a high gold... +unranked me. You don't see the opponents ranks, but I have to assume they are "balanced".

I have had many games where my stats (k/d/a) look terrible, but we won, and is was largely due to me.

My only experience with ranked play, was preliminaries back in season 2.
In every game but one, I won my lane convincingly (I'd go like 9/2 etc, I played mid or jung), and had my team feed. Lost all games, and before my final preliminary, I quit ranked, never to try again.

As a team game, it is a team performance that wins games, not heroes.
Solo queue is the pits, this is well known.
Either play ranked teams, or bite the bullet and deal with it.
Such is the nature of the beast.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Jhxwn6yi-MgSEbO2F-J-rq5EWxZM8ujr4W3o3S36vgs/edit?usp=sharing

I made this spreadsheet like 4 years ago and still to this day it stands to prove that using a personal scoring system WORKS.

I have proven that those players who care nothing more than kills will not gain a great score, those who play only for themselves will gain nothing and those who do not help the team get nothing.

I have proven that if you use my system you can and will gain LP if you go for the objectives and do what is needed, what the game was designed for, rather than trying to gain something just for yourself.
